P1-HG_1:
Microwave ovens cook food in an entirely different way than traditional ovens. Instead of using conduction heat, they use microwaves, which are a form of electro-magnetic radiation. One of the main advantages of microwave ovens over traditional ovens is speed. For example, it can take over an hour to cook a potato in an oven, but only about 5 minutes in a microwave. Why do microwaves work faster than conventional ovens?















In a traditional
oven, the heat that is generated initially only reaches the outside part of the
potato. In order for the potato to cook fully and be ready to eat, the heat has
to penetrate all the way to the center, which takes a long time. But
microwaves, unlike heat, can pass through the potato. The microwaves create
friction in the water inside the potato, which makes it heat up from the
inside. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P1-HB_1:
Microwave ovens cook food in an entirely different way than traditional ovens. Instead of using conduction heat, they use microwaves, which are a form of electro-magnetic radiation. One of the main advantages of microwave ovens over traditional ovens is speed. For example, it can take over an hour to cook a potato in an oven, but only about 5 minutes in a microwave. Why do microwaves work faster than conventional ovens?















In a traditional
oven, heat comes from one of two main sources: Gas ovens use combustion of
natural gas fuel, while electric ovens use current to heat metal coils. The
heat that is generated by the gas or the metal coils cooks the potato fully
enough to eat. But microwave ovens, unlike traditional ovens, convert
high-voltage electric energy to microwave radiation. The microwaves create
friction in the water inside the potato, which heats it. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P1-RG_1:
Microwave ovens cook food in an entirely different way than traditional ovens. Instead of using conduction heat, they use microwaves, which are a form of electro-magnetic radiation. One of the main advantages of microwave ovens over traditional ovens is speed. For example, it can take over an hour to cook a potato in an oven, but only about 5 minutes in a microwave. Why do microwaves work faster than conventional ovens?















In a traditional
oven, heat initially only reaches the outside of the potato. In order for the
potato to cook fully, the heat has to penetrate into the center, which takes a
long time. But microwaves, unlike heat, can pass through the potato. The
microwaves cause the water molecules inside the potato to vibrate. This
vibration creates friction between the water molecules and other parts of the
potato, which heats it up from the inside. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P1-RB_1:

electric ovens use current to heat metal coils. The heat from the gas or coils
cooks the potato. But microwave ovens, unlike traditional ovens, convert
electricity to microwave radiation. The microwaves cause the water molecules
inside the potato to vibrate. This vibration creates friction between the water
molecules and the other parts of the potato, which heats it. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
C2-HG_1:
Usually, chewing food doesn’t have any effect other than to break the food down into smaller pieces. But crunching a piece of hard candy between your teeth may additionally release a spark of light for a brief moment. This effect is known as “triboluminescence.” It will happen with just about any type of hard candy, but it is particularly noticeable with wintergreen flavored mints.

Why is the triboluminescence effect stronger with wintergreen mints? 















When you bite down on the candy, you break the crystalline structure of the
sugars in the candy, releasing energy into the air. This energy is released as
both visible light and non-visible light. This effect is more apparent to the
eye with wintergreen mints because wintergreen oil absorbs the non-visible
light that is released and converts it to a more visible form. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
C2-HB_1:
Usually, chewing food doesn’t have any effect other than to break the food down into smaller pieces. But crunching a piece of hard candy between your teeth may additionally release a spark of light for a brief moment. Why is the triboluminescence effect stronger with wintergreen mints?















When you bite down on the candy, you break the physical structure of the
candy inside your mouth, releasing energy into the air. This happens when the
hard candy is broken up by your teeth. This effect is more apparent to the eye
with wintergreen mints. Wintergreen oil, which flavors the candy, strengthens
the effect and leads to a brighter spark being released. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

B2-HG_1:
The Hawaiian bobtail squid lives in a symbiotic relationship with a species of bacteria known as Vibrio fischeri. The bacteria benefit from the relationship because they live inside the squid and receive necessary nutrients from it. The squid also benefits from the relationship: The bacteria protect the squid by helping to hide it from predators while it hunts at night.

Why are the bacteria able to protect the squid from predators? 















This type of bacteria live inside a special
organ inside the squid. When the concentration of the bacteria reaches a
certain threshold, it triggers a process that emits light. The light mimics the
effect of the moonlight filtering into the water from above, making the squid
essentially invisible to predators below it while it is active at night. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

N2-HG_1:
Some pharmaceutical drugs are designed to treat depression by affecting levels of serotonin, a chemical used by neurons in the brain for communication. When released from one neuron, serotonin binds with receptors on another and activates it. Lower levels of serotonin in the brain leads to less activation of these neurons. One class of antidepressants work by increasing the brain’s serotonin activity.

Why are serotonin-based treatments effective at combatting depression? 















Shortly after release, serotonin is reabsorbed
by the first neuron in a process known as reuptake. Antidepressants such as
Prozac inhibit the reuptake process by blocking the mechanism that transports
serotonin back into the neuron. Serotonin therefore stays in the synapse
longer, allowing for more activation of the postsynaptic neuron. This increase
in serotonin activity can relieve depressive symptoms for some patients. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
N2-HB_1:
Some pharmaceutical drugs are designed to treat depression by affecting levels of serotonin, a chemical used by neurons in the brain for communication. When released from one neuron, serotonin binds with receptors on another and activates it. Lower levels of serotonin in the brain leads to less activation of these neurons. One class of antidepressants work by increasing the brain’s serotonin activity.

Why are serotonin-based treatments effective at combatting depression?















There are many types of antidepressant
medications that target different chemicals in the brain. Antidepressants such
as Prozac are known as ‘selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors’ or SSRIs. They
inhibit the reuptake of serotonin by blocking the mechanism that transports
serotonin back into the neuron. Many different anti-depressants work by
targeting serotonin re-uptake, but Prozac and Zoloft are two of the most
common. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
N2-RG_1:
Some pharmaceutical drugs are designed to treat depression by affecting levels of serotonin, a chemical used by neurons in the brain for communication. When released from one neuron, serotonin binds with receptors on another and activates it. Lower levels of serotonin in the brain leads to less activation of these neurons. One class of antidepressants work by increasing the brain’s serotonin activity.

Why are serotonin-based treatments effective at combatting depression?















After release, serotonin is reabsorbed by the
first neuron in a process called reuptake. Antidepressants such as Prozac
inhibit reuptake by blocking the action of SERT, the protein responsible for
transporting serotonin back into the neuron. Serotonin therefore stays in the
synapse longer, allowing for more activation of the postsynaptic neuron. This
increase in serotonin activity can relieve depressive symptoms for some
patients. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Many types of antidepressant medications target

Y1-HG_1:
Sometimes people don’t notice something that’s right in front of them. When people view rapidly presented images and are told to press a button every time they see a house, they are generally good at this. However, if two houses are presented close together, people often fail to press the button for the second house. This failure to detect the second house is called “attentional blink.”

Why does the attentional blink effect happen?















The attentional blink effect occurs because of
how people’s perceptual and decision-making abilities function in response to
the stimuli. People are limited in how many things they can pay attention to at
any given point in time. They generally miss seeing the second house because
they are still processing the first and do not have enough attentional
resources left. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
Y1-HB_1:
Sometimes people don’t notice something that’s right in front of them. When people view rapidly presented images and are told to press a button every time they see a house, they are generally good at this. However, if two houses are presented close together, people often fail to press the button for the second house. This failure to detect the second house is called “attentional blink.”

Why does the attentional blink effect happen?















The attentional blink effect occurs because of
how people’s perceptual and decision-making abilities function in response to stimuli
like this. People are limited in how well they can perform on this type of
task. The second house appears later in the sequence than the first house, and
the failure to notice it when it appears causes the attentional blink. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

The attentional blink effect occurs because of

in response to stimuli. People are limited in how much they can pay attention
to at any given time. They miss seeing the second house because they are still
processing the first and do not have enough attentional resources left. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

S1-HG_1:
Men and women generally have equal intellectual abilities when it comes to learning about science and learning about the humanities. But in secondary school, boys tend to get higher grades in science and math classes, while girls tend to get higher grades in language and literature classes.

Why do boys and girls perform at different levels in different subjects?















Different cultural
norms govern the expectations that are put on boys and girls. Because boys and
girls are each expected to succeed in different subjects, this creates
different incentive structures for students’ efforts in different subjects.
Even though there are no intrinsic differences between boys’ and girls’
abilities, this differential encouragement leads to different grade
distributions for the two genders. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
S1-HB_1:
Men and women generally have equal intellectual abilities when it comes to learning about science and learning about the humanities. But in secondary school, boys tend to get higher grades in science and math classes, while girls tend to get higher grades in language and literature classes.

Why do boys and girls perform at different levels in different subjects?















Different cultural
norms govern the expectations that are put on students. Because boys and girls are
each expected to attend all of their classes, this creates different incentive
structures for students’ performance in their classes. Even though there are no
intrinsic differences between boys’ and girls’ abilities, boys outperform girls
in some subjects while girls outperform boys in others. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
S1-RG_1:
Men and women generally have equal intellectual abilities when it comes to learning about science and learning about the humanities. But in secondary school, boys tend to get higher grades in science and math classes, while girls tend to get higher grades in language and literature classes.

Why do boys and girls perform at different levels in different subjects?















Teachers and parents put
different expectations on boys and girls. Because teachers and parents expect boys
and girls to succeed in different subjects, each individual student puts more
effort into the subject where he or she is expected to succeed. Although there
are no intrinsic differences between boys’ and girls’ abilities, this
differential encouragement leads to different grade distributions for the two
genders. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
S1-RB_1:

Why do boys and girls perform at different levels in different subjects?















Teachers and parents put
different expectations on students. Because teachers and parents expect boys and
girls to attend all their classes, each individual student puts more effort into
their performance in the classes they are taking. Even though there are no
intrinsic differences between boys’ and girls’ abilities, boys outperform girls
in some subjects while girls outperform boys in other subjects. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
Att_1:
People are generally better at reasoning about typical members of a category than unusual members of that category. For example, if a person is told a fact about a type of bird (“All sparrows have livers”) and asked whether that fact is true of all birds, they are more likely to answer correctly if the fact is given about a stereotypical member of the bird category (e.g., sparrows, robins) than if an atypical bird is used (e.g., peacocks, penguins).



​Why are people better at reasoning about stereotypical animals?



Research shows that survey participants sometimes fail to pay full attention to the contents of survey items. In order to ensure that tasks are being performed correctly, researchers include questions that require participants to select a particular answer. Instead of rating the quality of this explanation, please select three on the scale below before continuing to the next question. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P2-HG_1:
Galaxies are typically categorized by their shapes. There are three main galaxy shapes: elliptical, spiral, and irregular. Both elliptical and spiral galaxies have masses of stars at their centers, around which other stars orbit. But some of the irregularly-shaped galaxies look like rings, without any mass of stars in their centers.

Why do some galaxies have empty space at the center?















The shape of a galaxy
is determined by the way that it was formed. A ring-shaped galaxy used to be a
spiral galaxy. At some point in time, a smaller galaxy traveled through the
center of the spiral galaxy. The central mass of the spiral galaxy was
attracted by the gravity of the smaller galaxy traveling through it and was
pulled away, leaving a hole in the galaxy’s center. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P2-HB_1:
Galaxies are typically categorized by their shapes. There are three main galaxy shapes: elliptical, spiral, and irregular. Both elliptical and spiral galaxies have masses of stars at their centers, around which other stars orbit. But some of the irregularly-shaped galaxies look like rings, without any mass of stars in their centers.

Why do some galaxies have empty space at the center?















The shape of a galaxy
is determined by the way in which it was formed. As part of the process of
galaxy formation, stars exert a gravitational pull on each other. When a spiral
galaxy forms, the spiral arms of the galaxy are attracted by the gravity of the
galaxy’s central mass. Sometimes, a spiral galaxy can undergo a change in its
shape and became a ring galaxy. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P2-RG_1:
Galaxies are typically categorized by their shapes. There are three main galaxy shapes: elliptical, spiral, and irregular. Both elliptical and spiral galaxies have masses of stars at their centers, around which other stars orbit. But some of the irregularly-shaped galaxies look like rings, without any mass of stars in their centers.

Why do some galaxies have empty space at the center?















The shape of a galaxy
is determined by how it was formed. A ring-shaped galaxy used to be a spiral
galaxy. At some point, a smaller galaxy traveled through the center of the
spiral. The stars that were at the center of the spiral galaxy were attracted
by the gravitational pull of each star in the smaller galaxy and were pulled
away, leaving a hole in the galaxy’s center. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P2-RB_1:

Both elliptical and spiral galaxies have masses of stars at their centers, around which other stars orbit. But some of the irregularly-shaped galaxies look like rings, without any mass of stars in their centers.

Why do some galaxies have empty space at the center?















The shape of a galaxy
is determined by how it was formed. In galaxy formation, stars exert a
gravitational pull on each other. When a spiral galaxy forms, the stars that
are in the spiral arms of the galaxy are attracted by the gravitational pull of
each star in the galaxy’s central mass. Sometimes, a spiral galaxy can undergo
a change in its shape and became a ring galaxy. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
C1-HG_1:
Wine is an alcoholic beverage made by pressing grapes and fermenting their juice. Wine is thus made up partially of alcohol, partially of water, and partially of dissolved grape solids. Some bottles of wine also contain small crystals, known as “wine diamonds,” which often can be seen sparkling on the bottom of the cork. Wine diamonds are more common when the wine is cold.

Why do wine diamonds form in cold wine?















Wine contains some ions
that come from the grape solids. Because warmer liquids contain more energy,
the water molecules in room-temperature wine move around and surround the ions.
The ions therefore cannot get close enough to each other to come together and
form a solid. The movement of water molecules decreases at lower temperatures,
allowing the ions to form solid crystals. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
C1-HB_1:
Wine is an alcoholic beverage made by pressing grapes and fermenting their juice. Wine is thus made up partially of alcohol, partially of water, and partially of dissolved grape solids. Some bottles of wine also contain small crystals, known as “wine diamonds,” which often can be seen sparkling on the bottom of the cork. Wine diamonds are more common when the wine is cold.

Why do wine diamonds form in cold wine?















Wine contains some ions
that come from the grape solids. Because some liquids contain more energy, the
water molecules in the wine mix with alcohol and the ions. The properties of
the ions typically allow for them to come together. After the wine is bottled,
wine diamond crystals attach to the cork, or sometimes they collect at the
bottom of the bottle. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
C1-RG_1:
Wine is an alcoholic beverage made by pressing grapes and fermenting their juice. Wine is thus made up partially of alcohol, partially of water, and partially of dissolved grape solids. Some bottles of wine also contain small crystals, known as “wine diamonds,” which often can be seen sparkling on the bottom of the cork. Wine diamonds are more common when the wine is cold.

Why do wine diamonds form in cold wine?















Wine contains ions
that have opposite charges. Because warmer liquids contain molecules with
greater kinetic energy, water molecules in room-temperature wine move around and
surround the ions. The ions cannot get close enough for their attraction to
each other to pull them together into a solid. The water molecules’ movement decreases
at lower temperatures, allowing the ions to form solid crystals. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
C1-RB_1:

Some bottles of wine also contain small crystals, known as “wine diamonds,” which often can be seen sparkling on the bottom of the cork. Wine diamonds are more common when the wine is cold.

Why do wine diamonds form in cold wine?















Wine contains ions
that have opposite charges. Because some liquids contain molecules with greater
kinetic energy, water molecules in wine mix with alcohol and the ions. The ions’
opposite charges typically allow for their attraction to each other to pull
them together. After wine is bottled, wine diamond crystals attach to the cork
or collect at the bottom of the bottle. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
B1-HG_1:
Cancer occurs when a buildup of cells in one part of the body forms a tumor that spreads to other tissues. Although some tumors are benign, malignant tumors can lead to a breakdown of normal bodily functions. Cancer cells can also break away from the original tumor and spread throughout the body, making treatment difficult.

Why do tumors form?















Under normal circumstances, some cells in the
body multiply when they are needed and die when they are no longer needed. Many
cancerous cells have a mutation in their cellular material. They do not
appropriately regulate cell division, and therefore they divide faster than the
other cells in the body. This leads to an excess of cancerous cells which are
clustered together in a tumor. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
B1-HB_1:
Cancer occurs when a buildup of cells in one part of the body forms a tumor that spreads to other tissues. Although some tumors are benign, malignant tumors can lead to a breakdown of normal bodily functions. Cancer cells can also break away from the original tumor and spread throughout the body, making treatment difficult.

Why do tumors form?















Under normal circumstances, some cells in the
body multiply when they are needed to carry out normal bodily functions. Many
cancerous cells have a mutation in their cellular material. Because cancer can
develop from any type of cell, cancerous cells can form tumors in different
bodily organs. When cancerous cells build up, they interfere with the organ’s
ability to maintain the health of the body. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Under normal circumstances, some cells in the
body multiply when they are needed and die when they are no longer needed. Many
cancerous cells have an error in the P53 gene. They do not appropriately

in the body. This leads to an excess of cancerous cells which are clustered
together in a tumor. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

N1-HG_1:
Neuroscience research uses numerous techniques to observe the human brain. In order to gather important data about brain activity, such as a cognitive defect caused by a stroke, different brain scanning techniques can be employed. Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) is a crucial tool in the study of neuroscience. It allows for the measurement of patterns of activation by monitoring blood flow in an active brain.

 

Why does fMRI use blood flow as an indicator of brain activity?

 

fMRI uses a magnetic field to measure the transport of oxygen through the brain. Blood carrying high levels of oxygen reacts differently to the magnetic field than blood carrying low levels of oxygen. Highly active brain areas will receive a higher amount of oxygen-rich blood to replenish the active cells. fMRI machines detect this flow of oxygen-rich blood to the active areas, providing data about neural activity. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
N1-HB_1:
Neuroscience research uses numerous techniques to observe the human brain. In order to gather important data about brain activity, such as a cognitive defect caused by a stroke, different brain scanning techniques can be employed. Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) is a crucial tool in the study of neuroscience. It allows for the measurement of patterns of activation by monitoring blood flow in an active brain.



​Why does fMRI use blood flow as an indicator of brain activity?















fMRI uses a magnetic field to measure relative
activity in different areas of the brain. Blood carrying high levels of oxygen
reacts differently to the magnetic field than blood carrying low levels of
oxygen. Highly active brain areas are detected using the magnetic field
generated by the fMRI machine. fMRI machines detect the flow of blood through
the brain, providing data about activity in each brain region. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Neuroscience research uses numerous techniques to observe the human brain. In order to gather important data about brain activity, such as a cognitive defect caused by a stroke, different brain scanning techniques can be employed. Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) is a crucial tool in the study of neuroscience. It allows for the measurement of patterns of activation by monitoring blood flow in an active brain.



​Why does fMRI use blood flow as an indicator of brain activity?















fMRI uses a magnetic field to measure the
transport of oxygen through the brain. Hemoglobin in blood that is carrying
oxygen has a different magnetic resonance than hemoglobin without oxygen.
Highly active brain areas will receive a higher amount of oxygen-rich blood to
replenish the active cells. fMRI machines can detect this flow of oxygen-rich
blood to the active areas, providing data about neural activity. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
N1-RB_1:
Neuroscience research uses numerous techniques to observe the human brain. In order to gather important data about brain activity, such as a cognitive defect caused by a stroke, different brain scanning techniques can be employed. Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) is a crucial tool in the study of neuroscience. It allows for the measurement of patterns of activation by monitoring blood flow in an active brain.



​Why does fMRI use blood flow as an indicator of brain activity?















fMRI uses a magnetic field to measure relative
activity in different areas of the brain. Hemoglobin in blood that is carrying
oxygen has a different magnetic resonance than hemoglobin without oxygen.
Highly active brain areas can be detected using the magnetic field generated by
the fMRI machine. fMRI machines detect the flow of blood through the brain,
providing data about activity in each brain region. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
Y2-HG_1:
People generally have difficulty in telling two faces apart if they come from a race other than their own. For example, in the United States, white people are typically better at recognizing white faces than black faces. The finding that it is more difficult in general to recognize faces of races different from one’s own is known as “the other-race effect.”

​Why does the other-race effect occur?

 
















The other-race effect is caused by a difference
in the way that people respond to faces within a particular group. In
communities where the majority of the people are white, white faces are seen
more frequently than are those of other races. This greater experience with
white faces tunes the perceptual system to recognize greater detail across
those faces, making it easier to tell them apart. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
Y2-HB_1:
People generally have difficulty in telling two faces apart if they come from a race other than their own. For example, in the United States, white people are typically better at recognizing white faces than black faces. The finding that it is more difficult in general to recognize faces of races different from one’s own is known as “the other-race effect.”

​Why does the other-race effect occur?
















The other-race effect is caused by a difference
in the way that people respond to the faces within a group. In communities
where the majority of the people are white, white faces are more easily
recognized by the community members than are those of other races. This greater
accuracy with white faces is due to the fact that the perceptual system is
responsible for perceiving faces. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

The finding that it is more difficult in general to recognize faces of races different from one’s own is known as “the other-race effect.”

​Why does the other-race effect occur?
















The other-race effect is caused by the way the
fusiform face area in the brain responds to faces within a group. In
communities where the majority of the people are white, white faces are seen
more frequently than are those of other races. This greater experience with
white faces tunes the fusiform face area to recognize greater detail across
those faces, making it easier to tell them apart. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

The other-race effect is caused by the way the

easily recognized by community members than are those of other races. This

S2-HG_1:
There are many different political systems in the world. Even among democracies, there are different ways that governments are organized. This is especially true when it comes to the number of active political parties. Some democratic countries have three or six or even ten major political parties with a role in the government, but the United States only has two.

Why has the United States maintained a two-party system? 















The two major US
political parties are very well established, and both are opposed to competing
against smaller parties. This leads to the assumption that no one other than a
major party candidate will generate enough votes to win elections. Votes cast for
third-party candidates are seen as ineffective, making it hard for these
candidates to establish themselves. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
S2-HB_1:

This is especially true when it comes to the number of active political parties. Some democratic countries have three or six or even ten major political parties with a role in the government, but the United States only has two.

Why has the United States maintained a two-party system?















The two major US
political parties are very well established, and both are sufficiently strong
to collect enough votes to win an election. This leads to the assumption that the
two major parties are very well entrenched in the political system. Votes cast in
elections are seen as ineffective, so the US continues to maintain a two-party
system. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

P3-HG_1:
The universe may be expanding. The light spectrums for elements in distant galaxies appear more red than the equivalent spectrums here on Earth. Because distant galaxies are most likely composed of the same materials as our galaxy, we would expect the spectrums to also be the same. Therefore, this “red shift” must occur because the galaxies are moving away from us.

​Why do distant galaxies appear red?















Distant galaxies appear red because, as galaxies
move away from us, each successive wave of light takes longer to arrive at the
Earth. This decrease in the frequency with which the waves arrive is equivalent
to an increase in the light’s wavelength. Longer-wavelength light looks more
red to us. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P3-HB_1:
The universe may be expanding. The light spectrums for elements in distant galaxies appear more red than the equivalent spectrums here on Earth. Because distant galaxies are most likely composed of the same materials as our galaxy, we would expect the spectrums to also be the same. Therefore, this “red shift” must occur because the galaxies are moving away from us.

​Why do distant galaxies appear red?















Distant galaxies appear red because the
galaxies’ movement away from us changes how the waves of light come from those
galaxies to the Earth. This modifies the way that we perceive the light
wavelengths coming from these galaxies in a way that makes it look more red to
us. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

C4-HG_1:
Graphite and diamond are both made primarily of carbon. However, despite their nearly identical makeup, their properties are very different. Graphite is soft, dark gray or black, and is used as an industrial lubricant to make machine parts more slippery. Diamond is extremely hard, colorless, and can be used in blades and abrasives for cutting or grinding other materials.

Why does carbon sometimes form soft graphite rather than hard diamond?















Graphite is made of layers of carbon that are arranged in 2-dimensional
sheets, which can easily slide sideways across each other. But the carbon that
makes up diamond is arranged in a rigid 3-dimensional structure that can’t easily
slide in any direction. Forming this rigid structure requires
extreme pressure. If the carbon is not under enough pressure, it is as likely
to form graphite as diamond. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Graphite is made of layers of carbon that are arranged in 2-dimensional
sheets which can easily slide sideways across each other. But the carbon that
makes up diamond is arranged in a rigid 3-dimensional structure that can’t
easily slide around. Even though these properties are very different, both
substances are made from the same material. Carbon can be formed into either
soft graphite or hard diamond. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Graphite is soft, dark gray or black, and is used as an industrial lubricant to make machine parts more slippery. Diamond is extremely hard, colorless, and can be used in blades and abrasives for cutting or grinding other materials.

Why does carbon sometimes form soft graphite rather than hard diamond?















Graphite is made up of layers of carbon atoms arranged in 2-dimensional
lattices with only weak interactions between layers, which can slide sideways
across each other. The carbon atoms in diamonds are strongly bonded in a rigid
3-dimensional lattice that can’t easily slide. Forming this rigid structure
requires extreme pressure. If the carbon is not under enough pressure, it is as
likely to form graphite as diamond. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

B4-HG_1:
Male anole lizards bob their heads up and down rhythmically as part of a mating ritual to attract females. They typically increase their rate of head-bobbing when they see a female lizard of their species. However, their rate of head-bobbing also increases when they see another male lizard of the same species, even if no female lizards are present.

Why do male lizards bob their heads when other males are nearby?















This happens because the male lizards are
extremely territorial, and head-bobbing is a distinctive behavior typical of
this particular species of lizard. During mating season when they are in
competition with each other for females, males use various dominance displays
to defend their territory. They perceive other males as a threat and engage in
increased head-bobbing, which is a sign of aggression. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Why do male lizards bob their heads when other males are nearby?















This happens because the male lizards are seeking
mates, and head-bobbing is a distinctive behavior typical of this species of
lizard. During mating season when they are trying to attract females, males use
a variety of behaviors that are characteristic of anole lizards. They perceive the
presence of other males and engage in increased head-bobbing, which is commonly
seen during mating season. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Why do male lizards bob their heads when other males are nearby?















This happens because the male lizards are extremely
territorial. During mating season when they are in competition with each other
for females, males use various dominance displays to defend their territory.
They perceive other males as a threat and engage in increased head-bobbing,
which is a sign of aggression. Aggressive behavior is known to be associated
with elevated levels of testosterone and other aggression-enabling hormones. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

N4-HG_1:
Morphine is an effective pain medication because it mimics the body’s natural pain relief mechanism. In response to a painful stimulus, the body releases endorphins. Endorphins bind to neurons in the brain, causing dopamine to be released. Increased dopamine in the brain reduces the feeling of pain. Morphine can also bind to endorphin receptors and cause the release of dopamine. Although morphine is very effective, it is also highly addictive.

Why is morphine addictive?















Morphine is addictive because prolonged use
decreases the sensitivity of the endorphin receptors in the brain. Thus, the
body’s own endorphins become less effective, and the user experiences painful
withdrawal symptoms. Because the receptors become less sensitive to the drug,
over time the user requires larger doses to achieve the same effects. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
N4-HB_1:
Morphine is an effective pain medication because it mimics the body’s natural pain relief mechanism. In response to a painful stimulus, the body releases endorphins. Endorphins bind to neurons in the brain, causing dopamine to be released. Increased dopamine in the brain reduces the feeling of pain. Morphine can also bind to endorphin receptors and cause the release of dopamine. Although morphine is very effective, it is also highly addictive.

Why is morphine addictive?















Prolonged used of morphine leads to changes in
the endorphin receptors in the brain. Users will generally experience cravings
for more of the drug. When a person stops taking it, they often experience
painful withdrawal symptoms. Such symptoms can last for up to 72 hours and
include aching muscles, anxiety, and insomnia. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Morphine is addictive because prolonged use
changes the protein structure of the endorphin receptors, decreasing their sensitivity.

painful withdrawal symptoms. Because the receptors become less sensitive to the
drug, over time the user requires larger doses to achieve the same effects. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Y3-HG_1:
People’s word-association abilities change depending on how long it takes them to say the first word that comes to their mind. Words that are said very quickly after hearing the target word are likely to sound similar to the target. However, words that are said after a short delay are more likely to have a similar meaning to the target.

​Why does timing affect the type of words people associate with a target?















The effect of timing on word associations is due
to the cognitive system that allows people to use language. This system
categorizes words first according to their sounds and later according to their
meanings. Therefore, the more time one takes to say an associated word, the
more likely it is that that word will have a similar meaning to the target
word. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

However, words that are said after a short delay are more likely to have a similar meaning to the target.

​Why does timing affect the type of words people associate with a target?















The effect of timing on word associations is due
to the cognitive system that allows people to use language. This system associates
two different types of words with the target word at different times.
Therefore, the more time one takes to say an associated word, the more likely
it is that that word will have a similar meaning to the target word. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

The effect of timing on word associations is due
to Broca’s area, a part of the brain’s language system. This brain area categorizes
words first according to their sounds and later according to their meanings.
Therefore, the more time one takes to say an associated word, the more likely
it is that that word will have a similar meaning to the target word. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

S3-HG_1:
People who are experts in a certain field know a great deal about that field. Such people should be able to make good decisions about issues concerning that field. But when these abilities are put to the test, it is often the case that groups of ordinary, independent people make better decisions about certain issues than individual experts. This is known as “the wisdom of crowds.”

Why do groups make better decisions than individuals?















The aggregated
information brought together by a group is a more representative sample of the
total information available, so a group will know much more in total about a
topic than any individual expert can. Putting this information together takes
everyone’s knowledge into account, and can therefore lead to a better decision. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
S3-HB_1:
People who are experts in a certain field know a great deal about that field. Such people should be able to make good decisions about issues concerning that field. But when these abilities are put to the test, it is often the case that groups of ordinary, independent people make better decisions about certain issues than individual experts. This is known as “the wisdom of crowds.”

Why do groups make better decisions than individuals?















The aggregated
information brought together by a group can lead to more appropriate decisions
being made, so a group will decide how to think and act about a topic better
than any individual expert can. Working together in a group can benefit
everyone, and can therefore lead to a better decision. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Every person knows a
unique set of facts which together create a more representative sample of the

any individual expert can. Putting this information together takes everyone’s
knowledge into account, and can lead to a better decision. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

P4-HG_1:
When you ride in a car with a helium balloon, you will observe a curious phenomenon. Although people and other objects in the car will move backwards when the car accelerates and forward when it brakes, the balloon will move in the opposite direction. It will drift forwards as a car accelerates and backwards as it brakes.

​Why does a helium balloon move with a car rather than against it?















A helium balloon
floats because it contains helium gas. Denser air below the helium balloon exerts
pressure that pushes the balloon upwards. When a car accelerates, the air in
the car is pushed backwards. This creates higher pressure at the rear of the
car than at the front. The increased pressure at the back of the car pushes the
balloon forwards. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
P4-HB_1:
When you ride in a car with a helium balloon, you will observe a curious phenomenon. Although people and other objects in the car will move backwards when the car accelerates and forward when it brakes, the balloon will move in the opposite direction. It will drift forwards as a car accelerates and backwards as it brakes.

​Why does a helium balloon move with a car rather than against it?















A helium balloon
floats because it contains helium gas, which is also used as a coolant in
rocket engines. When a car accelerates, the air in the car is affected by the
acceleration and there is higher pressure at the rear of the car than at the
front. These changes in pressure don’t affect solid objects in the car, which
slide backwards. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

​Why does a helium balloon move with a car rather than against it?















A helium balloon
floats because it contains helium gas. Denser air below the balloon exerts pressure
that pushes the balloon upwards. When a car accelerates, air molecules in the
car are pushed backwards. There are now more molecules at the rear of the car
than the front. The increased number of molecules at the back of the car push
the balloon forwards. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

C3-HG_1:
Smog is a type of air pollution that makes breathing difficult and reduces how far one can see into the distance. In the 1990s, the city of Los Angeles had an especially bad problem with smog. Although smog was present nearly every day of the year, it appeared to be much denser and darker when the weather was hot.



Why does smog look denser when the weather is hot?
 

Smog contains two types of gas, one of which is dark brown (NO2) and the other of which is colorless (N2O4). The reaction that makes the dark brown gas needs energy to happen. Higher temperatures provide greater thermal energy. So more of the brown gas and less of the colorless gas is formed on hot days, making the air look darker. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
C3-HB_1:
Smog is a type of air pollution that makes breathing difficult and reduces how far one can see into the distance. In the 1990s, the city of Los Angeles had an especially bad problem with smog. Although smog was present nearly every day of the year, it appeared to be much denser and darker when the weather was hot.



Why does smog look denser when the weather is hot?
 

Smog contains two types of gas, a dark brown one (NO2) and a colorless one (N2O4). The reaction that makes the dark brown gas involves both oxygen and nitrogen. Higher temperatures provide greater thermal energy. The amounts of the two gases that are present in the smog vary from day to day, though some amount of each gas is always present. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Why does smog look denser when the weather is hot?
 

Smog contains two gases, a dark brown one (NO2) and a colorless one (N2O4). The reaction that makes the dark brown gas requires energy. Higher temperatures provide greater thermal energy, which is associated with faster movement of gas molecules. So the equilibrium between the two gases is shifted on hot days. More brown gas is formed, making the air look darker. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Higher temperatures provide greater thermal energy, which is associated with faster movement of gas molecules. B3-HG_1:
The waves in the wake of a ship on the ocean at night will often appear to glow. The glow is not reflected light from the moon or the lights of the ship. Rather, it is produced by organisms in the ocean. The process by which some organisms produce their own light is known as “bioluminescence.”

Why do these bioluminescent organisms produce light?















Dinoflagellates are
single-celled algae. They exist in high concentrations, and they are the most
common source of bioluminescence in the ocean. These algae use bioluminescence
as a defense mechanism. The mechanism that produces the light is triggered by a
mechanical disturbance, such as a passing ship. The algae emit light to ward

Why do these bioluminescent organisms produce light?















Dinoflagellates are
single-celled algae. They exist in high concentrations, and they are the most
common source of bioluminescence in the ocean. These algae use bioluminescence
as a biological mechanism. The light-producing mechanism is triggered by some
events, such as a passing ship. When the algae begin producing light, it causes
the glowing phenomenon in the wake of the ship. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

N3-HG_1:
Exposure to artificial light may be disruptive to sleep. This is especially true for blue light from high efficiency light bulbs and electronic devices. People who wear blue-light blocking glasses for 3 hours before going to bed have higher sleep quality and better mood than people who don’t.

Why does blue light disrupt sleep cycles?















Sleep cycles are governed by a part of the brain
called the suprachiasmatic nucleus (SCN). The SCN receives input from the eyes
and is sensitive to light. It also produces a hormone important for regulating
sleep patterns. When it reaches the eye, blue light triggers the suppression of
the SCN’s production of this hormone. Lower levels of the hormone interfere
with the ability to regulate sleep. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Y4-HG_1:
Babies are capable of doing simple arithmetic. For example, babies see a doll placed on a stage that is then hidden behind a screen. Then, they see a hand place another doll behind the screen. They look longer if the screen is dropped to reveal only one doll instead of two. This looking time difference between one and two dolls shows that babies can calculate 1 + 1 = 2.

Why does this looking time difference show that babies can do arithmetic?















Babies’ understanding of numbers and mathematics
starts to emerge early in their lives. This understanding of numbers governs
the babies’ expectations about how many dolls there should be on the stage. The
babies know that there should be two dolls on the stage, and their surprise at
seeing only one leads to their looking longer. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

Why does this looking time difference show that babies can do arithmetic?















Babies’ understanding of numbers and mathematics
starts to emerge early in their lives. This understanding of numbers governs
the amount of time babies look at the stage. This time is indicative of how
long they attend to the display, and it can be used to calculate babies’ tendency
to look at the single doll when it appears. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?

S4-HG_1:
Neighborhoods with visible petty crime, such as vandalism and graffiti, tend to also have higher levels of major crime, such as robbery and murder. When steps are taken to prevent petty crimes, the rate of major crimes goes down as well, even if nothing is done to specifically prevent major crimes. This has been called the “broken windows” theory of crime.

Why does cleaning up vandalism and graffiti reduce crime rates of major crime?















When a neighborhood
is not kept clean, this is taken as an indication of low police presence in the
area. Therefore, this neighborhood comes to be seen as somewhere major crimes
can be committed without risk of being caught. However, maintaining the
neighborhood by cleaning up graffiti and replacing broken windows leads to the perception
of an increased police presence. This perception works as a deterrent against
all criminal activity, including major crimes. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
S4-HB_1:
Neighborhoods with visible petty crime, such as vandalism and graffiti, tend to also have higher levels of major crime, such as robbery and murder. When steps are taken to prevent petty crimes, the rate of major crimes goes down as well, even if nothing is done to specifically prevent major crimes. This has been called the “broken windows” theory of crime.

Why does cleaning up vandalism and graffiti reduce crime rates of major crime?















When a neighborhood is
not being kept clean, this is taken as an indication of low police interest in
preventing vandalism. Therefore, this neighborhood comes to be seen as a place
where graffiti and vandalism are common occurrences. However, maintaining the
neighborhood by cleaning up graffiti and replacing broken windows leads to the perception
of an increased police presence directed at preventing vandalism. This perception
works as a deterrent against petty crimes. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
S4-RG_1:

This has been called the “broken windows” theory of crime.

Why does cleaning up vandalism and graffiti reduce crime rates of major crime?















When a neighborhood
is not kept clean, criminals take this as an indication that police officers are
not present in the area. Therefore, criminals see this neighborhood as
somewhere that major crimes can be committed without risk of being caught.
However, maintaining the neighborhood by cleaning up graffiti and replacing
broken windows leads people to think that police officers are paying increased
attention. Criminals are therefore deterred from committing crimes, including
major crimes. - How would you rate the quality of this explanation?
